lines.text: Henniker? Proper bastard if you ask me.
What started the trouble between Major Carrington and his colonel?
Good heavens no, not a woman. Nothing so reasonable.
What was Colonel Henniker doing during the war?
Yes that's more like it. Anti-aircraft command the whole contest.
No - Woolwich, Chatham and all stations to Dover. Never out of touch with the Southern Railway.
Well, you don't blame him for that do you?
Me? I blame him for everything.
I'll tell you what happened that night and it'll save you the trouble of lying about it.
I'm not saying he wasn't a fool but I'm certain he isn't a thief.
